B. 12.5% chance

C. 50% chance

D. 66% chance

E. 10% chance

G. No chance

Since she's a phenotypically normal woman, her genotype must be HH. Therefore, the father has XH and Xh (because he has hemophilia). Each daughter gets an X from the father and one from the mother. Since the mother contributes an H, each daughter has a 50% chance of receiving Xh, resulting in hemophilia. Each son gets an X from the father (either H or h) and a Y from the mother. Since the father has a 50% chance of passing H and a 50% chance of passing h, each son has a 50% chance of having hemophilia.
